description.narrative: (Zambia): The Commercial Agribusiness for Sustainable Horticulture (CASH) activity increases rural incomes through sustainable production and marketing of horticultural products in Zambia. Implemented by a regional NGO, CASH trains farmers in production technologies, such as pre- and post-harvest quality control, integrated pest management procedures, post-harvest loss reduction and storage mechanisms, and food safety and quality. The project will also continue to promote improved water and soil management, and conservation agriculture. CASH will link farmers to new markets, such as hotels, supermarkets, and food processing factories. With FY14 funds, 4,500 horticulture farmers will receive technical assistance in agricultural productivity and will plant over 1,000 hectares of horticulture crops. Trade in horticultural products is expected to increase by 400 percent reaching $6,000,000, and increasing participating farmers' incomes by 40 percent.

participating-org.narrative: Agribusiness in Sustainable Natural African Plant Products
